intro: Neoboivinella wilmsii, commonly known as the Wilmsii boivinella, is a rare and unique member of the Fabaceae family. It is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and clusters of pea-like flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant is native to specific regions in South America, particularly in Brazil, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its seeds are enclosed in small, hairy pods, and the plant is often found in association with other understory species in tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Neoboivinella wilmsii is considered a species of conservation concern.
